titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B173a_01
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-B173a_01

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

1.ydʿʾb | ḏbyn 2.[b](n) | šhr | mkrb | qtbn | w= 3.[l](d) | ʿm | w-ʾwsn | w-kḥd w-[d=] 4.[hsm] | w-tbnw | w-yrfʾ | ʾymnn 5.[w-ʾšʾ]mn | nqz | w-wzl | w-brr | msbʾ 6.[w-mnq]l | ẓrm | b-ʾmr | ʿm | ḏ-šqr | b-ʿm | w-b 7.[ʾnby | w-]b | ʿm | ḏ-rymt | w-b | ʿm | ḏ-šqr | w-b 8.[ḥwkm | w-](b | ḏt | ṣntm |) w-b | ḏt | ẓhrn | w-b | ḏt | rḥbn 9.[ʾwsʿm | bn | yṣrʿm | bn | mdhm | tqdm | w-ḥrg | kl] 10.[ʿšq | w-wzl | w-ṣll | mnqln | ẓrm | b-tḥrg | mrʾ-s] 11.[ydʿʾb]

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān 2.[bi]n Shahr, ruler of Qatabān and the chil- 3.ʿAmm and of ʾAwsān and of Kaḥid and 4.and of Tubanū and of Yarfaʾ, the southern lands 5.has excavated and smoothed and opened up the road 6.Ẓarim at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr-by ʿAmm and by 7.by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymat and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr and by 8.by Dhāt-Ṣanatim and by Dhāt-Ẓahirān and by Dhāt-Raḥībān.
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān 2.[bi]n Shahr, ruler of Qatabān and the chil- 3.[d]ren of ʿAmm and of ʾAwsān and of Kaḥid and of [Da-] 4.[hasum] and of Tubanū and of Yarfaʾ, the southern lands 5.[and the nor]thern, has excavated and smoothed and opened up the road 6.[and pas]s of Ẓarim at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr-by ʿAmm and by 7.[ʾAnbay and] by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymat and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr and by 8.[Ḥawkam and] by Dhāt-Ṣanatim and by Dhāt-Ẓahirān and by Dhāt-Raḥībān. 9.[ʾAwsʿamm bin Yiṣūrʿamm of the lineage of Madahum led and directed all of] 10.[the cutting and smoothing and paving of the pass of Ẓarim at the directive of his lord,] 11.[Yadaʿʾab.]

Text preserved in this squeeze:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān
bin Shahr, ruler of Qatabān and the chil-
ʿAmm and of ʾAwsān and of Kaḥid and
and of Tubanū and of Yarfaʾ, the southern lands
has excavated and smoothed and opened up the road
Ẓarim at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr-by ʿAmm and by
by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymat and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr and by
by Dhāt-Ṣanatim and by Dhāt-Ẓahirān and by Dhāt-Raḥībān.
Restored full text of the inscription:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān
bin Shahr, ruler of Qatabān and the chil-
dren of ʿAmm and of ʾAwsān and of Kaḥid and of Da-
hasum and of Tubanū and of Yarfaʾ, the southern lands
and the northern, has excavated and smoothed and opened up the road
and pass of Ẓarim at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr-by ʿAmm and by
ʾAnbay and by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymat and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr and by
Ḥawkam and by Dhāt-Ṣanatim and by Dhāt-Ẓahirān and by Dhāt-Raḥībān.
ʾAwsʿamm bin Yiṣūrʿamm of the lineage of Madahum led and directed all of
the cutting and smoothing and paving of the pass of Ẓarim at the directive of his lord,
Yadaʿʾab.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān
bin Shahr, ruler of Qatabān and the chil-
ʿAmm and of ʾAwsān and of Kaḥid and
and of Tubanū and of Yarfaʾ, the southern lands
has excavated and smoothed and opened up the road
Ẓarim at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr-by ʿAmm and by
by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymat and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr and by
by Dhāt-Ṣanatim and by Dhāt-Ẓahirān and by Dhāt-Raḥībān.
Restored full text of the inscription:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān
bin Shahr, ruler of Qatabān and the chil-
dren of ʿAmm and of ʾAwsān and of Kaḥid and of Da-
hasum and of Tubanū and of Yarfaʾ, the southern lands
and the northern, has excavated and smoothed and opened up the road
and pass of Ẓarim at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr-by ʿAmm and by
ʾAnbay and by ʿAmm Dhū-Raymat and by ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr and by
Ḥawkam and by Dhāt-Ṣanatim and by Dhāt-Ẓahirān and by Dhāt-Raḥībān.
ʾAwsʿamm bin Yiṣūrʿamm of the lineage of Madahum led and directed all of
the cutting and smoothing and paving of the pass of Ẓarim at the directive of his lord,
Yadaʿʾab.

Restored full text of the inscription:
Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān
bin Shahr, ruler of Qatabān and the chil-
dren of ʿAmm and of ʾAwsān and of Kaḥid and of Da-
hasum and of Tubanū and of Yarfaʾ, the southern lands
and the northern, has excavated and smoothed and opened up the road
and pass of Ẓarim at the command of ʿAmm Dhū-Shaqīr-by ʿAmm and by

Ḥawkam and by Dhāt-Ṣanatim and by Dhāt-Ẓahirān and by Dhāt-Raḥībān.
ʾAwsʿamm bin Yiṣūrʿamm of the lineage of Madahum led and directed all of
the cutting and smoothing and paving of the pass of Ẓarim at the directive of his lord,
Yadaʿʾab.
